Title: Toy Story
Writer: John Lasseter, Pete Docter, Andrew Stanton, Joe Ranft, Joss Whedon
Actors: Tom Hanks, Tim Allen, Don Rickles, Jim Varney
Plot: A cowboy doll is profoundly threatened and jealous when a new spaceman figure supplants him as top toy in a boy's room.
Awards: Nominated for 3 Oscars. Another 27 wins & 23 nominations.

Title: Jumanji
Writer: Jonathan Hensleigh, Greg Taylor, Jim Strain, Chris Van Allsburg
Actors: Robin Williams, Kirsten Dunst, Bonnie Hunt
Plot: When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped for decades and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.

Title: Grumpier Old Men
Plot: John and Max resolve to save their beloved bait shop from turning into an Italian restaurant, just as its new female owner catches Max's attention.

Title: Waiting to Exhale
Actors: Whitney Houston, Angela Bassett, Loretta Devine
Plot: Based on Terry McMillan's novel, four women share a friendship that helps them through their individual struggles with men, careers and families.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 12 wins & 17 nominations.

Title: Father of the Bride Part II
Writer: Albert Hackett, Frances Goodrich, Nancy Meyers
Actors: Steve Martin, Diane Keaton, Martin Short
Plot: In this sequel, George Banks deals with his daughterâ€™s pregnancy and with the unexpected news that his own wife is expecting as well.

Title: Heat
Actors: Al Pacino, Robert De Niro, Val Kilmer
Plot: A group of professional bank robbers start to feel the heat from police when they unknowingly leave a clue at their latest heist.
Awards: Nominated for 1 BAFTA. Another 5 wins & 17 nominations.

Title: Sabrina
Writer: Samuel A. Taylor, Billy Wilder, Barbara Benedek
Actors: Harrison Ford, Julia Ormond, Greg Kinnear
Plot: An ugly duckling having undergone a remarkable transformation, still harbors feelings for her crush, a carefree playboy, while his serious brother has designs on her.
Awards: Nominated for 2 Oscars. Another 2 wins & 4 nominations.

Title: Tom and Huck
Actors: Jonathan Taylor Thomas, Brad Renfro, Rachael Leigh Cook
Plot: A mischievous young boy, Tom Sawyer, witnesses a murder and teams up with his friend Huck Finn to save the innocent.

Title: Sudden Death
Actors: Jean-Claude Van Damme, Powers Boothe, Raymond J. Barry
Plot: A former fireman takes on a group of terrorists holding the Vice President and others hostage during the seventh game of the NHL Stanley Cup finals.

Title: GoldenEye
Writer: Ian Fleming, Michael France, Jeffrey Caine
Actors: Pierce Brosnan, Sean Bean, Izabella Scorupco
Plot: James Bond teams up with the lone survivor of a destroyed Russian research center to stop the hijacking of a nuclear space weapon by a fellow agent formerly believed to be dead.

Title: The American President
Actors: Michael Douglas, Annette Bening, Martin Sheen
Plot: A widowed U.S. president running for re-election and an environmental lobbyist fall in love. It's all aboveboard, but "politics is perception," and sparks fly anyway.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 13 nominations.

Title: Dracula: Dead and Loving It
Writer: Mel Brooks, Rudy De Luca, Steve Haberman
Actors: Leslie Nielsen, Mel Brooks, Peter MacNicol
Plot: Mel Brooks' parody of the classic vampire story and its famous film adaptations.

Title: Balto
Actors: Kevin Bacon, Bob Hoskins, Bridget Fonda
Plot: An outcast half-wolf risks his life to prevent a deadly epidemic from ravaging Nome, Alaska.

Title: Nixon
Writer: Stephen J. Rivele, Christopher Wilkinson, Oliver Stone
Actors: Anthony Hopkins, Joan Allen, Powers Boothe
Plot: A biographical story of former U.S. president Richard Nixon, from his days as a young boy to his eventual presidency which ended in shame.
Awards: Nominated for 4 Oscars. Another 8 wins & 17 nominations.

Title: Cutthroat Island
Writer: Michael Frost Beckner, James Gorman, Bruce A. Evans
Actors: Geena Davis, Matthew Modine, Frank Langella
Plot: A female pirate and her companion race against their rivals to find a hidden island that contains a fabulous treasure.

Title: Casino
Actors: Robert De Niro, Sharon Stone, Joe Pesci
Plot: A tale of greed, deception, money, power, and murder occurs between two best friends: a mafia enforcer and a casino executive, compete against each other over a gambling empire, and over a fast-living and fast-loving socialite.
Awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 9 nominations.

Title: Sense and Sensibility
Actors: Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, James Fleet
Plot: Rich Mr. Dashwood dies, leaving his second wife and her daughters poor by the rules of inheritance. The two eldest daughters are the titular opposites.
